Class Opcode

  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Get the bytecode length of the opcode. Default value is 1, but the PUSH statement overrides this method.
        Returns:
        length in byte of the opcode.

      • getStackConsumed

        public abstract int getStackConsumed()
        Get the number of elements that the opcode consumes. They have to be already in the stack.
        Returns:
        consumed stack elements.

      • getStackGenerated

        public int getStackGenerated()
        Get the number of elements that the opcode generates on the stack. Default value is 1, but some opcodes override this method
        Returns:
        generated stack elements.

      • getOpcodeID

        public OpcodeID getOpcodeID()
        Default getter for opcodeID
        Returns:
        opcodeID

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Default getter for Name
        Returns:
        name of the opcode

      • getBytes

        public java.lang.String getBytes()
        Assembles the opcode giving the bytes representation
        Returns:
        bytes representation

      • getOffset

        public long getOffset()
        Default getter for the offset, the position in the code
        Returns:
        offset of the opcode

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        String representation of the opcode, with offset and name e.g. "0: PUSH1 60"
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        "offset: opcode"

      • isSameOpcode

        public boolean isSameOpcode​(Opcode other)
        Checks whether the other opcode represents the same one, even if with a different offset
        Parameters:
        other - opcode to test
        Returns:
        if they represents the same opcode

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
        Two opcodes are equals iff they have the same opcodeID and offset
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - other object to test
        Returns:
        if they are equals

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Default hashcode. It's calculated as a xor between opcodeID hashcode and the offset
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        hashcode
